values: Title: Dean Winchester's Fabulous Bedtime Stories of Awesome Author: Summary: The first few weeks back on the road together have been a little awkward. Who knew porny bedtime stories were all it would take to break the ice? Word Count: ~350 Rating: PG-13 Warnings: non-incestuous brotherly mutual masturbation Disclaimer: If the boys were mine, there would be way less drama and a lot more fluff. And porn. Definitely a lot more porn. :) Notes: I had this whole fluffy and porny birthday fic all planned out but the muse refused to cooperate. So here's a silly little offering instead. Happy Birthday, Dean! "Dean? You awake?" "What is it, Sammy?" "Could you... tell me a story?" Sam's voice was tentative. Dean snorted. "Who are we, the Grimm brothers? I don't know any stories." "Yeah, you do. Like you used to tell me? The bedtime stories?" Finally Dean got it. His breath caught in his throat. This was better than he'd ever hoped for. "Bedtime stories of what?" he asked, keeping his tone light. Hell if he was gonna have a chick flick moment over porny bedtime stories. "Do I really have to say it?" "If you want the story, you gotta use the proper name for it." Sam huffed. "Fine. Could you please tell me one of Dean Winchester's Fabulous Bedtime Stories of Awesome?" Dean grinned into the darkness. "You got it, dude." He paused for a moment, dredging up a memory and decorating it a bit. "So, I was at the library-" Sam snorted. "Dude, seriously? You?" "Do you want the story or not, bitch?" "Yeah. Sorry. Jerk," Sam added under his breath, a hand snaking into his boxers. Dean's bedtime stories were almost better than actual porn. "So, there was this totally hot librarian..." ~*~*~ A few nights later, in a motel room far, far away: "Sammy? You awake?" "Yeah." "Your turn, dude." "My turn for what?" "Tell me one of yours. You did get some at college, right? 'Cos otherwise I'm disowning you." "And what do we call them?" Sam grinned into the darkness. "Sam Winchester's Slightly Less Awesome But Still Better Than Nothing Bedtime Stories?" Sam huffed out a little laugh. "Fine, I'll take it." He paused for a second to rifle through his memories and pick a good one. One that would impress Dean. Then he got it. "Yeah, so I was at a bar, right?" Dean snorted. "You? Seriously?" "Yes, Dean. I went to the occasional bar while I was at college. Now do you want the story or not? Jerk." "Let's hear it then, bitch." "So, there were these twins..." "Dude!" Sam smirked at the admiration in Dean's voice. Impressing his big brother still felt every bit as awesome as it always had.

Migraines are a bitch. :( Title: Happy 32nd, Sammy Author: Characters: Sam and Dean Winchester Word Count: ~290 Rating: PG Warnings: Schmoop Disclaimer: Not mine. Just playing with them a bit for fun. Will return them just as I found them. :) Notes: I meant to write an actual fic for Sam's birthday, but I'm having a migraine, so this is all I managed for now. At least it's kinda cute. :) Dean came back from a supply run and headed straight for the kitchen, barely giving Sam a nod in passing. Sam shrugged and went back to the ancient grimoire he was studying. He hadn't really expected Dean to remember, not with everything they had going on. Just when Sam had started to wonder what was taking him so long, Dean reappeared, a bottle in one hand and a plate in the other. He plonked the bottle on the table in front of Sam. Sam glanced at it, went back to reading and then did a double take. "Smirnoff? Seriously?" Dean shrugged. "You're into that crap, aren't you?" Sam swallowed. He'd had no idea that Dean knew he secretly preferred vodka. Whiskey had always been the drink of choice in his family, so, since he didn't drink all that much, he'd never bothered to get himself a bottle. A drink of Dean's whiskey now and then was just fine. But... Sam smiled up at his brother, at a loss for words. Dean cupped his face for a second, a thumb sliding over a dimple on Sam's cheek. "Missed those," he muttered, almost too softly for Sam to hear. He cleared his throat, clearly embarrassed for the chick-flick moment, and put the plate down right on top of Sam's very old and very valuable book. Sam grabbed the plate quickly and slid the grimoire a safe distance away. Only then did he take a look at the sandwich sitting on the plate. Sam stared at it for a second, smelled it, and then lifted the top slice to make sure. His eyebrows flew up. "Banana and peanut butter?" Dean smirked at him. "Happy birthday, bitch."

Title: Restless Author: Fandom: Torchwood Characters: Myfanwy (I'm sorry! XD) Rating: Very light R Warnings: Um, wanking pteranodon? (That has got to be the weirdest warning ever! :D) Words: 380 Summary: It's spring and all males of her species are millions of years away. Myfanwy discovers a way to make herself feel better. Disclaimer: I own nothing. I just play with other people's toys for fun. Notes: For day 1 of . I'm so sorry! I have no idea where this came from. :D Myfanwy was feeling restless. She had been cooped up in the human-cave forever and for what? A minor incident with a small human female she hadn't even eaten or anything. She'd just wanted to smell her. Well, okay, so maybe also take a tiny nibble, but what did humans need that many fingers for, anyway? The Leading-Male Jack had been quite unreasonable, really. Like it was her fault the small human had smelled so enticingly of fish and her humans never fed her fish. Tethering her to a not-wood perch was so unfair. The stupid humans should have learned to speak by now but no, they insisted on her learning their words. So how was she supposed to explain that spring was a time when she craved fish? Truth be told, fish wasn't the only thing she craved. Spring was also mating season. The males would bring her presents of fish and seaweed, as much as they could carry. The bigger the portion, the stronger the male... She was getting uncomfortably restless now, thinking about the meaning of spring. The restlessness focused on a specific part of her anatomy, demanding for relief. She pressed herself against the cold surface of her perch, gently sliding from side to side. Oh, that was it. Right there... She thought of a male, a large, strong, beautiful male with a beak full of fish. He would be the biggest of the whole flock, come to woo her and her alone. He would have a huge, masculine crest, flaming red at the tip, fading to orange along the shaft, a black circle at the base. She moved faster. Almost there... They would take to the air together, his wings casting a huge shadow over the water, scaring off shoals of fish. She would try to outfly him at first, of course, as a matter of pride. Eventually, she would let him catch her and... An intense flash of pleasure went through her, nearly unseating her from her perch. Flapping her wings twice, she regained her balance and let out a small, satisfied cry. She had discovered a way to relieve the restlessness now, at least for a little while. Soon, she would fly the skies again. Jack never could stay mad at her for long, after all.

Title: Brothers Author: Pairing: George/Percy Rating: PG Summary: What happens in the bushes stays in the bushes. Warnings: Nothing, apart from the pairing. Disclaimer: Harry Potter characters are the property of J.K. Rowling and Bloomsbury/Scholastic. No profit is being made, and no copyright infringement is intended. Word Count: ~600 Notes: Written for round 13 on . My sincere apologies for the lateness! (And for it not being a sequel. *shameface* It would make a nice prequel for a story I've been contemplating, though.) A head appears in the upper floor window. "George," Percy calls out. George drops the gnome he has been half-heartedly tickling and looks up. "How can you tell? How can you always tell?" He seems genuinely puzzled. "Because you move differently," Percy answers, sounding a bit awkward. "You're more... graceful." George laughs. "Graceful? Clumsy old me? Come on, big brother, insincere flattery'll get you nowhere." "I'm not insincere." Percy huffs indignantly. "If you are going to be like that, I will talk to Fred instead. Where is he, anyway?" For once, George is de-gnoming the garden alone. Fred is nowhere in sight. "I'd rather not shout it from down here," George answers, smiling conspiratorially. "Come on down and I might tell you." Percy grimaces. "I was going to ask you to come up." "Bro, you haven't been outside all summer. All you do is work, work, work. Would it kill you to take a break? Workaholic." "My work is very important, but I'm not a workaholic!" "Prove it and come out." George grins. "Fine. Hang on a second." The head disappears.
*~*~*
"She wants you to do what?" George asks, laughing. The boys are sitting down by the pond, under a flowering bush that both shades them and hides them from sight. "Woo her." Percy blushes. "How does one do that?" "You're asking the wrong twin, mate. Fred's the one with all the girls." "I know. But you don't tease me as much as he does." "Dear brother, no one teases you as much as Fred does." The brothers share a look. "But I'm a good second, though." Percy shrugs. "Who else am I going to ask, Ron?" For a rare moment, they laugh together, in perfect accord. George wipes his eyes theatrically. "You know, Perce, you'd be okay if you'd just unbutton a bit." On a whim, he pulls Percy's glasses off. "Now, about that wooing business..." "Yes?" Percy leans closer, suddenly too close and too familiar. George has to look away. "You look her deep in the eyes and say something beautiful, I reckon. To start with." "Like how I love the way the sky is reflected in your eyes?" Percy says softly. "Well, maybe something a bit less cheesy. Besides, aren't her eyes brown?" George looks up to find Percy studying him closely. Suddenly he realises. "Oh." That's as far as he gets before Percy's lips brush against his. He doesn't pull away. For a few seconds, the world turns and lives hang in the balance. Then George breaks the kiss. "I'm still your annoying little brother." "And I'm your annoying big brother." Percy clears his throat. "Please don't tell Fred about my- my wooing problem." "Right. Penelope." George hands back Percy's glasses. "Right. Best not talk about it. Like ever." "Right." Percy casts about for a change of subject. "Where is Fred, anyway? I've been watching you play two people since lunch. Not that I was watching you. Um." George goes for his customary grin and almost gets there. "Fred's away on business." He taps his nose. "Ask me no more and I shall not have to lie to you, brother." "He's seeing Angelina, isn't he?" "Perhaps. Among other things." "Right. Well, this has been fun." Percy coughs, face suddenly bright red. "I mean, I've probably had enough fresh air for today. And I've got a report to finish. But thanks for the chat." "My pleasure." George matches his brother's blush. "I mean... Um. Enjoy your report." "Right. I'll- I'll see you later, George." "Later, Perce."

Title: The Game Author: Fandom: Torchwood Characters: Jack, Tosh Rating: R Warnings: Voyerism Words: 350 Date: May 2 Summary: Over the years, Jack has developed the Game. Notes: For the second day of . I'm going to have all team members do it somewhere in the Hub. ;) Jack looked around the morgue, trying to remember which spot he had left hidden from the cameras. It was a security risk, of course, creating blind spots, but Jack was all for taking risks. That was how he had invented the Game. The rules had been developed over more than a century, becoming more elaborate every year. Not only were the dates now set, but places as well. The time of day added a random element to the system, affecting the next location, which in turn affected the date. Sometimes both were so risky that it was a miracle he had never been caught. But the risk of discovery was, of course, the fun bit. So, the morgue. Not the most stimulating of places, unless you were into stuff even Jack frowned upon. Banishing the thought, he walked up to the wall where the door was. The corner closest to the door, the one you could see into before you opened the door more than a hand's width. In other words, the safest spot to leave unguarded. He wasn't an idiot, after all. Jack smiled. The camera blind spots were cheating, of course. Even when playing against himself, Jack loved to cheat. Leaning against the wall, Jack closed his eyes and concentrated on his favourite fantasy. *** Tosh was disgusted with herself. She should close the monitor and get back to work. In fact, she should have done that the first time. Working out Jack's system and realigning the cameras had definitely been crossing the line. But Tosh couldn't help herself. It was too fascinating, figuring out the pattern in Jack's wanking habits. Not to mention watching the act itself. She had never harboured sexual feelings towards Jack the way nearly everyone seemed to. He was gorgeous, of course, but not quite Tosh's type. At least that was what she told herself. The shiver she could not suppress when she watched Jack take his cock in hand and begin to stroke was a perfectly normal reaction. She was a fully functional woman, after all, and she'd been celibate for way too long. That was what she kept telling herself.

Title: Love Interrupted Author: Pairing: Lucius/Narcissa Summary: Narcissa and Lucius are trying to get intimate but Draco keeps interfering. Word Count: 230 Rating: PG-13 Warnings: None Disclaimer: Not mine. Make no money. Please don't sue. Notes: Another little story I found in my notebook re the song guessing meme. This is for . (Does anyone know what happened to her, btw? She's been inactive for months.) She wished for another Malfoy family moment, with the prompt 'Valentine's Day'. Narcissa sighed. She should have known better than to try and organise a romantic evening with a small child in the house. She had put Draco to bed only half an hour before his usual bedtime, but the little brat had refused to stay there. So far, he had harassed her and Lucius twice, first to ask for another bedtime story, then to demand hot chocolate. On his second visit, he had also managed to trip up the house-elf, breaking a bottle of very expensive champagne in the process. Why, oh why could she not have a single normal relative? A sister perhaps, one who had not turned blood traitor or landed herself in Azkaban, who could babysit for her while she enjoyed some much needed quality time with her husband.. Heaving another heart-felt sigh, Narcissa concentrated on rediscovering the right mood. Just when the kisses were turning passionate again, the door opened a third time. "Mummy-" Draco began, saw the slightly compromising position his parents were in and fell silent. Narcissa scrambled up from Lucius' lap, crossed her hands over her bare breasts and then just stood there, not quite knowing what to do next. After a long awkward silence, Draco opened his mouth again. "Mummy, what were you doing to Daddy?" Narcissa and Lucius exchanged a 'who's going to take care of this?' -look. Lucius was the first to look away and Narcissa suppressed a smirk, promptly fleeing the room. The best thing about having a contest of wills with Lucius was that she won. Every time.

Title: Void Author: Characters: A myriad of bad guys Word Count: 200 Rating: PG Warnings: None Notes: Written for 's prompt "the dark empty place all evil things go to, when the hero defeats them" at . See if you can identify all the fandoms! :) There is a black, howling emptiness at the edge of the world. It creates its own world, yet it isn't one. It has many names: some call it the Void, some the Nothing, some call it Hell. It is all of those things and none. It is densely populated, yet every inhabitant is alone. Some escape it from time to time, in one form or another, but they always come back in the end. There are metallic shapes, flashing silver and bronze, screaming as they fall from nowhere to nowhere. So many, so very many tortured lack of souls calling out a single name, over and over. There is a black shape that is all eye, brandishing a fist that lacks a finger, and shadows follow it. There is a pale, snakelike man, a flayed baby, crying at the injustice of its demise. There is a woman, larger than life, white and green and witch. She is perhaps the one who escapes the most, but that does not save her. Nothing can. There is no absolution, no end to fear and rage. There are no heroes here. They cannot enter, nor would they, for they are the ones who created this place.

Title: Seaside Rendezvous Author: Pairing: Jack/Ianto Word Count: 500 Rating: PG Warnings: Fluff :) Disclaimer: Not mine. Make no money. Please don't sue. Notes: My first attempt at Torchwood! A completely pointless piece of fluff, really. Written for 's prompt "swimming in the ocean with your clothes on" at . Of course, I read 'swimming' as 'making out' ;) The title is a nod to Queen, for no particular reason, except that I rather like the band. (Although, now I think about it, it does seem strangely appropriate :) ) "Come on, the water's lovely," Jack calls from the water. "Liar," Ianto mutters, "this is Wales. The water's never lovely." "What did you say?" Jack laughs. "If it was something about the quality of Welsh seawater, I'm going to have to come and get you myself." He takes a threatening step back towards the shore. "I'd like to see you try," Ianto calls back, even though he knows better. Jack never could resist a dare. Jack starts towards the shore so quickly that the resistance of the water trips him up. Ianto smirks as he watches his captain scramble back up, wet shirt clinging to his torso. The view is so nice that he loses most of his lead. When he finally remembers to run, Jack is only ankle deep in the water, and Ianto knows his bare feet will give better purchase on the loose wet sand than his own trainers. He tries to run anyway, for the look of the thing. Jack trips up again, but still catches him easily enough. He's wet and sandy all over as he tackles Ianto to the ground. "Get off!" But Ianto doesn't try too hard to push him off, even though the cold water seeps through his clothes and the sand already seems to creep everywhere. He still barely admits it even to himself, but he loves Jack's weight holding him down, loves the hot breath on his neck, the hands wrapping around him. No one is, or ever will be, like Jack. "Oh, I will," Jack whispers in his ear, the tone making Ianto blush. "But I'm taking you swimming first." With that, he gets up and pulls Ianto with him. Before Ianto has time to protest, Jack has already scooped him up like a child and is carrying him towards the water line. Ianto suppresses the urge to squeal like a little girl and instead struggles in what he hopes is a manlier fashion. "Let me go," he hisses. But Jack keeps his hold until they are almost waist deep in the water, and Ianto has to stop kicking because he's splashing water onto his own face. Only then does Jack let go. Spluttering, his clothes suddenly heavy and nose full of water, Ianto resurfaces. Jack laughs at his angry glare, says he looks like a drowned puppy, and offers a hand to help him up. Ianto takes the hand, and pulls hard. Caught off guard, Jack falls down right next to Ianto. When he gets his face back above the water, he grabs Ianto by the shoulders. "Sneaky," he breathes in Ianto's face. Without thinking, Ianto leans forward and kisses Jack. His lips are salty and warm and soft. For once, Jack doesn't take control of the kiss, only follows Ianto's lead. The world narrows down to two pairs of lips moving together and time stops. This is a perfect moment, Ianto knows, one of those rare moments that allow you to die happy in the knowledge that you've lived.

Notes: Written for the prompt 'Pain' at . Follows TV canon (this totally happened between seasons 1 and 2 ;) ) He bites into me and it hurts. It fucking hurts. Yet I feel my dick getting hard. No. He's taken my freedom, my dignity, most of my sanity. I will not give him this. His hand moves down my abdomen. I try to get the goodies out of his reach, but he holds me down with one hand, while the other continues its exploration. "Please, don't." I bite my tongue, but too late. It's hardly a breath, but of course he hears. These undead motherfuckers hear everything. "Oh, yes. I most definitely will," he breathes against my neck.

I can't believe this shit! It's fucking snowing. Really, properly snowing. Just when the last of the old snow was finally melting and the first flowers were coming up :( It's starting to feel like this fucking winter's NEVER going to end :( :( Seriously, it went from green grass and clear sidewalks to this in a couple of hours: To add insult to injury, I had to sit inside for most of the almost-spring. First with school stuff and for a little over a week now with a sprained ankle (and the school stuff, of course, but let's not get into that :D). If I were rich I'd totally spend the winters somewhere warm :(

Title: Forgiveness Is a Virtue Author: Pairing: implied Draco/Katie Word Count: 250 Rating: PG Warnings: Angst Disclaimer: Not mine. Make no money. Please don't sue. Notes: Written for week 170 at . I can't believe I forgot to post this, seeing as I won and all (YAY!). *shakes head* I blame school :) "I'm sorry! I'm so sorry!" Katie is crying, her face splotchy and ugly. "Bitch!" Draco hisses. "You almost spoiled everything. Do you realise how much more difficult this is going to be now that everyone's suspicious?" "I know. I'm sorry! My hands just slipped. I honestly didn't mean to mess it up." Something about the girl, lying on the hospital bed and crying her heart out, evokes feelings Draco didn't even know he was capable of. She looks so pathetic that he ought to loathe her even more, but suddenly he doesn't. "I believe you." There's genuine warmth in his voice. He reaches a tentative hand to wipe off a tear. "I forgive you." Instead of making her stop, the unexpected tenderness makes her sob harder. Draco turns away in disgust. "Stop," she whispers, making a visible effort to control herself. "Please." Draco pauses and looks down at her. "I doubt you can be of further use to me." "Please. Give me another chance. I'll do anything!" Draco sighs. This is exactly why he doesn't like girls. They are so fucking needy. But there's something in her eyes that stops Draco from walking out of the room. Devotion. Utter and unconditional. Draco sits down on the edge of the bed and takes her hand. She squeezes his fingers and smiles hopefully. Draco smiles back. It never hurts to have a secret asset stashed away for future use. Especially since procuring it takes so little effort.

I scored some American pancakes today! Finding maple syrup was a bit harder, so in the end I had to settle for maple syrup flavoured corn syrup. (Which sounds utterly ridiculous to me, but of course I'm no expert. Maybe maple syrup is that expensive?)

Anyway, I was a little worried that the pancakes would be a bit of a disappointment, since I've been wanting to try some for ages (you don't really come across them outside American films and tv-series around here). But they're actually sort of brilliant. Teeth-rottingly sweet to begin with, and then I get to pour syrup on them? God bless America. :)

I'm really, really supposed to be studying, so of course I'm reading fic :) There was this really great thing posted on today. I don't usually read Hermione fic, so I was just going to take a quick look at the artwork. Somehow I ended up glancing at the beginning of the fic, too and it just pulled me right in. It's elegant darkfic. All the elements of a Voldemort won!story are there, but it's not quite as in-your-face about it as they often are. The POV is nicely detached. Oh, and it's a really good Narcissa voice! I'm still too much in awe to find the right words to describe it. Maybe there are no words. Anyway, the fic is The Flower and Willow World by and you should definitely go read it. Like, right now! Uh, and I'll go back to informetrics, which I just don't get. At all. Why the hell do I need to know how to do a stupid citation analysis (not to mention master webometrics) to work at a damn library? Sheesh.

Shhh... I'm not really here. Officially, I'm buried under a bloody mountain of schoolwork. Ugh. On the bright side, I'm almost halfway through my Library and Information studies. That much closer to being a librarian. Yeah, I finally caved. I mean, my first word was book. I pretty much had no choice in the matter :) But fucking hell, I miss this. LJ. Fandom. People. I miss it so much. I keep telling myself to "grow up", to "live in the real world" (HAH. Me and the real world in the same sentence... the universe may be about to explode.), but the truth is, I don't want to. So I may be lurking a bit and occasionally breaking my long silence... Now that I've finally started living in the 21st Century and gotten myself a smartphone, I'm hoping I'll be able to do this, just a little bit. Like on bus rides to the university or smth. I dunno. I just want to come back. Even if it's just a little bit. Oh, and if I'm going to be here for more than, like, five minutes, I'll really need to get my paid account back. These bloody ads are killing me :) Ugh, and now I'll stop rambling and go back to my paper on collection development. I love you all.

I left just in time, it seems. Yes, I realise it's an incredibly selfish thing to say, but I'm really glad I'm back in Finland, safe and sound, instead of being in London right now. And I'm glad I don't follow news. I went through London Sunday night to get to Stansted. I'm not sure I would have dared if I had known about the riots at the time. It's only now slowly sinking in. My hands are shaking so hard it's difficult to type. I was in London Sunday night. Anything could have happened. Ok, I need to calm down. Ok, calmed down a bit. Still can't believe it. This is the kind of thing that's supposed to happen far, far away, not practically on your doorstep. Everyone living anywhere near the "war zones", please, please stay safe! I hope things calm down soon. I honestly don'tknow what to say. I'm shocked and appalled. Sorry, this was not the Yay, I'm back! post I had meant to make. I'll squee some other day, I promise. Anyway, I'm back to regular internet access now, so I can friend all the lovely people I met at Diacon (the ones that I haven't already friended back, that is. You all are lovely, too.) Now I need to unpack, read all the TiRN I've missed and go by my mum and dad's to prove that I'm alive and well. See ya later!

I'm in the same very friendly hostel as last year! (Seriously, if you're ever in Cardiff, I heartily recommend Riverhouse Backpackers. It's the cosiest, cleanest and nicest hostel I've ever been to!) I had planned a nice picnic in Bute park, but it's raining cats and dogs :( So I'm sitting in the hostel instead, eating welshcakes and enjoying the free Wi-fi :) Aww, and the owners' cat just joined us! He totally acts like he owns the place :)

London was... uneventful. The hostel was crappy and I was a bit too tired to handle the crowds. But everything went exactly to plan, so that's good. Stonehenge was impressive, but I would probably have spent more than twenty-ish minutes looking at it if it hadn't rained so much. The one time I forget to bring my umbrella! My t-shirt is still a bit wet :) And now I have two umbrellas: my regular one and a Union Jack one (I'm not too much into that type of tourist stuff, but it was all I could find on Trafalgar Square. And it kept me dry.) :P

I hope the weather is better tomorrow, so that I can finally have my picnic :) I'm also thinking of going to the Bay. I still haven't managed to find it on foot, so I thought I might give it one more try :) I always get lost when I'm leaving the city centre. Maybe it's one of those places that only exist when you have the right transport... XD

OMG, these welshcakes are SO GOOD! You know how when you miss a food, you start to remember it tasting way better than it actually does, so that when you have it again, you're actually a bit disappointed? Well, this is the exact opposite of that! Yays!

I want to move here and never ever leave! I wonder if they could use a Finnish translator or a librarian in Cardiff...

ETA: This is the best hostel EVER! Out of the blue, I was offered cookies and ice cream! Lovely, huge, hot-from-the-oven cookies! And I have just enough ice cream left to enjoy a welshcake with it, too! I love this place!

OMG, I'm too excited to sleep! I'm leaving for the UK tomorrow morning! This time I'm not studying anything, just playing tourist. :) And attending Diacon Alley, of course! YAYS!

Oh, by the way, how many of you will I be seeing at the con? Does anyone want to plan to meet up or should we just randomly run into each other? (I'm pretty sure it'll be small enough that we won't miss each other, though... But it would really suck if that should happen!)

ZOMG, this summer's going to be AWESOME! First I'm staying in London overnight and visiting Stonehenge. (Yes, I know it's not in London XD I just found a cheap London based tour :P)

Then I'm going <s>home</s> to Cardiff for a bit. I miss the place so much it's unreal! After that, I'm staying in Llandudno and (hopefully) exploring that side of Wales for a few days. Then back to London to meet up with <lj user="ms_anthrophy">, who's coming for the con. We'll have a few days to hang out before and after the con. Yays!

After <lj user="ms_anthrophy"> flies back to Finland, I head out to Edinburgh to see everything I missed last summer. On my way back to London, I'll stop in York for a week to see all the cool museums the city seems to be full of (according to their website, anyway). And then I'm probably so broke that it's a bit of a relief to fly back home where I can always invite myself to my parents' for dinner if I can't afford food :P

Sorry, I'm babbling :) I'm just so frigging excited! I love traveling! I feel so much more alive and less depressed and anxious and scared of bloody everything when I'm on foreign soil. I dunno, maybe Finland just doesn't agree with me :P

Eep, I really have to pack the computer and go to bed! I've only five hours to sleep as it is :)

I can't sleep but I can't do anything useful either :( It's just too damn hot :( I really need to work on my fic but all I seem to be able to do tonight is watch the Big Bang Theory. Yeah, silly thing to get addicted to :) At least I was moderately productive today: I fixed the creaking hinges on my balcony door that have been bugging me for ages. Apparently olive oil works :) AND I did something totally heroic (me-heroic, that is). There was a spider on my balcony and I got rid of it all by myself! Yes, I realise it doesn't sound like much of an accomplishment but when it's me we're talking about, it's huge. Believe me. I've been known to scream at a picture of a spider and throw a full hysterical fit at seeing a toy spider. So it was a heroic deed, okay? :)
